class_notes: When we sit down at the table to eat, many different factors influence our food choices and its preparation. In this course, students will learn and use evidence-based nutrition knowledge to examine the potential benefits of a plant-based diet. In addition, students will consider the potential influence of science, culture, sociology, economics and sustainability on these choices. Topics of investigation will be presented through a transdisciplinary perspective utilizing lectures and group discussions, hands-on cooking experiences, group projects and community engagement.
course_description: We will examine the evidence for potential benefits of a plant-based diet and apply the findings through hands-on cooking experiences, group projects and community engagement. We will consider the potential influence of science, culture, sociology, economics, and sustainability on dietary choices.
